abstracts.cdata!:
The Sixth Power Project was achieved.
            Through the project, the Bank made a positive contribution
            to physical and institutional development. The main weakness
            of the Bank's performance were: (a) inadequate emphasis
            on project implementation arrangements; and (b) inadequate
            assessment of the Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB)'s
            project management capability and the impact of the
            continuing exodus of experienced staff from CEB on project
            management. Project implementation experienced long delays,
            necessitating extension of the credit closing date by three
            years. The main reasons for the project slippages included:
            (i) delays in finalizing the co-financing arrangement; (ii)
            protracted internal procurement processing; (iii) poor
            performance of contractors; (iv) weak project management;
            and (v) occurrence of civil disturbances. Technical
            assistance should be incorporated in the project scope to
            address identified deficiencies The importance of conducting
            a thorough review during project appraisal of the
            constraints facing project implementation and the project
            entity's project management capacity cannot be over-stressed.
